body_html:
@sdsy888 That .rst file is written by hand...or actually, by...hands. You can see the history of the .rst file here.

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commits/master/docs/source/tensors.rst

The .rst references parts of the code base with sphinx directives, like:

.. class:: Tensor() and .. automethod:: add

The directives are added in as new methods are added. It is not autogenerated. I think originally this was probably done because of limitations with autogenerated docs, and perhaps autogenerating would show some code that wasn't ready to be in the docs.

The .rst files are processed with sphinx-build, sphinx-apidoc isn't used.

body:
@sdsy888 That .rst file is written by hand...or actually, by...hands. You can see the history of the .rst file here. 

https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/commits/master/docs/source/tensors.rst

The .rst references parts of the code base with sphinx directives, like:  

.. class:: Tensor() and .. automethod:: add

The directives are added in as new methods are added. It is not autogenerated. I think originally this was probably done because of limitations with autogenerated docs, and perhaps autogenerating would show some code that wasn't ready to be in the docs. 

The .rst files are processed with sphinx-build, sphinx-apidoc isn't used.
